Package etomica.util.random

Class RandomNumberGeneratorUnix

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.util.random.RandomNumberGeneratorUnix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRandom

    public class RandomNumberGeneratorUnix
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRandom
    Random number generator that takes random bits from files. This can be used with the unix special files /dev/random or /dev/urandom.

    Due to file access, this is likely to be slower than other RNG, but could be used to provide an initial seed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomNumberGeneratorUnix

        public RandomNumberGeneratorUnix​()
        Create an RNG using /dev/urandom as a source of random bits.

      • RandomNumberGeneratorUnix

        public RandomNumberGeneratorUnix​(java.lang.String randFile)
        Create an RNG using the given file as a source of random bits.

        /dev/urandom as a randFile will not block /dev/random as a randFile may block if the entropy pool is depleted

    • Method Detail

      • getRandSeedArray

        public static int[] getRandSeedArray​()
        Convenience method that returns an array of integers, useful as seeds to another RNG. If an instance of this class can be instantiated, it is used to return 4 integers. Otherwise, System.nanotime is split into 2 integers.

      • main

        public float nextFloat​()
        Returns a random float, uniformly distributed between 0 and 1. Neither 0 nor 1 will ever be returned.

      • nextDouble

        public double nextDouble​()
        Returns a random double, uniformly distributed between 0 and 1. Neither 0 nor 1 will ever be returned.
        Specified by:
        nextDouble in interface IRandom

      • nextFixedDouble

        public double nextFixedDouble​()
        Description copied from interface: IRandom
        Returns a pseudorandom double, uniformly distributed between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive). For computational speed, this implementation returns a fixed-point random number (at least in binary), meaning that it will be a random integer times 2^-53.
        Specified by:
        nextFixedDouble in interface IRandom

      • nextGaussian

        public double nextGaussian​()
        Returns a double taken from a Gaussian distribution with 0 mean and variance of 1.
        Specified by:
        nextGaussian in interface IRandom
